Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Tanadam
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at Hotel Doria and were quite happy with our stay. The only downside is the size of the room and shower, but as this is somewhat usual for european hotels we sort of expected it and it gave us quite a laugh when my husband had to squeeze into the tiny shower. Not to mention the tiny elevator that can fil either two skinny people or aone person and their luggage, actually gave us quite a giggle, very unique. If you can overlook this you will enjoy your stay in this quaint hotel. It is close to Termini station and less than a 10minute walk to the Colosseum and Palatine. The staff were very helpful and polite, the nearby restaraunts were good for dinner and not too expensive, overall a great stay in Rome at Hotel Doria.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!! I would definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Travellingcanuk91
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. Restaurant's are close by, the main train station (with shuttle busses and trains to both airports) is a 5 minute walk, the colloseum isn't far, and the sightseeing tour bus has a stop right next to the church which meant we never had to take the public transit. The man working the front desk was more than helpful and took the Time to explain a map of the city to us which was helpful. This area the hotel is in gave my stay a true "roman" feel, when you opened the shutters you could see people on vespas racing down the streets, see people enjoying coffee, pizza, and gelato in the restaurants down below. I would most definitely reccommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Rome!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Manc_Chaz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Doria for 3 nights in February from 20th-23rd. We chose the hotel because of its proximity to Termini station and also the amount of good reviews it had received on tripadvisor. We certainly were not disappointed, it is one of the best hotels I've ever stayed in at a European city, especially for the price we paid. From the minute we arrived to the minute we left, it was welcoming, friendly and cosy. All of the reception staff we encountered were cheerful and extremely helpful in offering advice on the best places to eat etc. and were all very knowledgeable in providing good information about their city. They always had the time of day for your questions. The room was very spacious, clean and tastefully decorated with a comfortable bed and good overall facilties. My only slight complaint is that the bathrooms are very small and cramped but it was no major problem. We had a room overlooking the street which was great for us as we loved having the buzz of the city come in through the window. If you are easily disturbed or don't like a lot of traffic noise, I would suggest requesting a room at the back of the hotel. The continental breakfast on offer was delicious and had a large variety to choose from. The lady who looked after you at breakfast was again very friendly and worked hard. The breakfast room is on the 6th floor and has an outdoor terrace area overlooking the city. Although it wasn't 'officially' open up to use with it being winter, we asked if we could sit out on 2 of the mornings and it was no problem. It's very pleasant and I can imagine it being beautiful eating breakfast out there on a summer morning. As for the location, the hotel is just 5 mins walk from Termini, very handy for the shuttle coaches and train services to both Rome airports. The Colosseum is just a 10 min walk away through a very nice park and the historic centre is a 15-20 min walk away. You will find many hotels a lot closer to the historic area and its attractions but take my advice, if you want a friendly, well priced, good quality, decent hotel, then look no further. We enjoyed every minute of our time in Rome and much of this was because our stay at the Doria was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Long weekend in Rome at the Hotel Doria”
Reviews.Author: Susan D
Reviews.Content: Our trip was from the 10th - 14th February 2012. Great, cosy hotel in the centre of Rome, 5 minutes walk from the main train station and 10 to 15 minutes walk to all the key attractions. The staff were really friendly and very helpful in their pointing out places to visit and directions as it was our first time in Rome. We also visited for the first snow in 26 years - while unusual for the city, the hotel was comportably warm.

Reviews.Title: “Good small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cazzie_Smith
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three night Rome break - 30th November 2011 to 3rd December 2011. Location of hotel is good. Close enough to the station but not too close as some areas closer by did seem a "little rough". The street (Via Merulana) leads straight up to the Santa Maria Maggiore. There are side streets coming of it with restaurants and cafes, also a nice little Irish pub that we drank in. Each member of staff that we saw in the Hotel were friendly and helpful, had no problems on checking in and out. All spoke good English. I was expecting the room to be exceptionally small based on other reviews but it was of a standard size. Minibar in the room (which I thought was cheap to how much you get charged in UK) and TV although no English channels. Bathroom was very small as was the shower but spotlessly clean. Breakfast was nice, nothing fancy but got everything we needed. Because it was winter the Roof terrace was not open to sit out and have breakfast but it was unlocked so could go out to have a look around and see the Colosseum in the distance. All in all a nice small hotel, clean and friendly. If went to Rome again on a budget would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for City Break”
Reviews.Author: Maeve22
Reviews.Content: Fantastic little hotel that is great for a city break. The location is second to none, 5 - 10 min walk to Station Termini, 5 min walk to Colusseum, beside stop for city bus tours and close to metro station. This hotel is very clean with friendly staff. The only complaint that I would have with this hotel is that it is not well signed and when we arrived we walked past it as we were on the opposite side of the street and didn't notice it! This hotel also has the smallest lift I have ever seen (taking 1 person at a time), not ideal when your room is on the 5th floor. Overall we had a very pleasant stay and would not hesitate to recommend to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for a good price!”
Reviews.Author: Katherine S
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed at this hotel for two nights at the end of a vacation. This hotel is centrally located and it was very easy to find our way around Rome. If you plan on doing a lot of walking in Rome I suggest getting a real street map and not one of those tourist maps (they are missing a lot of the streets). The room was small but it was prefect for two people. Beds were comfortable and clean. The staff was very helpful as well!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot for seeing the sights of Rome”
Reviews.Author: merito_10
Reviews.Content: We overnighted in Rome, arriving by train from Naples. The hotel is easy to find - and only about 10 minutes walk from the railway station. We had read previous reviews saying that they would recommend a room at the back of the hotel but our room was street side. Although it would be noisy if you had the window open, it was quiet when closed and the air conditioning was excellent. No noise from that. The bed was the most comfortable we had experienced in our 6 weeks away and the pillow soft. The staff were extremely helpful and one gentleman suggested a good (not tourist) restaurant nearby which he rang and booked a table at for us. An excellent choice. I think it was called Nouve Stela. Lovely food and good atmosphere. The breakfast was fine and although it was a little bit cooler, we enjoyed eating on the rooftop terrace.

Reviews.Title: “value for money great location”
Reviews.Author: margaret m
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at hotel doria with my husband and adult son. The rooms were clean and comfortable. We had room over the street. 1st night was noisy rest of stay fine. Service good throughout our stay. Cleanliness outstanding. Breakfast was fine, would have got boring on longer stay though. Mini bar was good value for money. Also 2 cheap su[ermarkets round the corner. Lots of good eating places within 5-10 mins walk. Bad points, size of lift, but it is a very old building. Like over reviewers, would have loved to have used the roof top terrace in evenings. Great location for seeing sights. Only used metro to reach the vatican.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, location and basic services”
Reviews.Author: CertainStandards
Reviews.Content: Our group rented 3 rooms at the Doria for 2 nights prior to boarding a cruise this summer. There is nothing fancy here but the hotel met our expectations: good value, well-situated, rooms clean and comfortable, attentive staff. There are however a few things that should be kept in mind if you do chose to book. First off, ask for a room facing the courtyard. The rooms facing the street can be noisy, especially with the windows open. Secondly, if you are claustrophobic, the elevator will be a challenge. In this case make sure that your room is on one of the lower floors so as to not have too many stairs to climb to your room. Another small detail that management should take into consideration: we would have loved to take better advantage of the roof-top dining area. I understand that there could be security issues with it not being staffed at any other time besides breakfast, but we would have loved to have shared a bottle of wine up there and unwind after a day of taking in the beauty of the Eternal City. It would have made our visit to Rome that much more memorable. We appreciated what the Doria has to offer and have no problems recommending it.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Shadow_Moon7
Reviews.Content: Hotel Doria is in a perfect location, close to all the main attractions in Rome. The hop on hop off bus tours run right around the corner, which we found very useful to get around the city. The hotel itself is very small, but the staff were extremely friendly and spoke good English. The rooms are to a good standard, the only concern we had was the size of the shower which some people may struggle with! The Breakfast provided was just perfect before a busy day. The hotel also offers free wi-fi, an extra bonus! Overall we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Hotel Doria and would definitely recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Cute, Clean, Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: LindyLouHB
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights and couldn't be more pleased with our choice. The gentlemen at reception were a delight, always friendly and helpful with a smile on their faces. Our room was a good size and had the best pillows out of all the hotels we stayed at while in Italy. It was also perfect for those all important afternoon siestas, quiet, cool and dark. The shower was tiny but good water pressure and always hot. The rooftop breakfast room was a nice touch, loved the smell of the herbs growing in pots, and after only one morning the lovely lady in charge remembered what coffees we drunk. The Doria was also ideally situated. We never had to go more than a block to find a nice restaurant and had the added convenience of a nearby grocery store. Have already recommended it on a travel message board I frequent.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, cute hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sydney_CJ
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at Hotel Doria in Augist 2010. The hotel is a short walk from the Termini train station and very easy to find. It is also close to the subway and there was a laundromat and grocer around the corner. It's location is walking distance to many of Rome's great attractions. Our room was comfortable - not huge, but enough room to have our luggage out and have some space. The room was bright and even though it faced over the road, it was not nearly as noisy as some others have stated. There was glass windows and shutters outside to keep out the noise and light - along with good thick curtains. We also had air-conditioning which kept it comfortable in the hot summer. Plus we had decent beds, so I slept well! The bathrooms are small, but functional - the shower cubicle is small, but gets the job done. More importantly - it was always clean! The outstanding feature is the rooftop terrace for breakfast - we certainly enjoyed going up there every morning! Lovely view and very calm and relaxing. All the staff were very nice - the gentleman at the front counter always said hello and allowed us to store our bags all day after we checked out. The cleaning staff were great - our room was always spotless and clean and the brekfast ladies were always very polite.

Reviews.Title: “Good home base for Rome”
Reviews.Author: pixie5008
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Doria was a very convenient home base for a 3-night stay in Rome. Walking distance or extremely short cab ride from the main train station, so it was really easy when we first arrived from the airport. It's also really close to a large monument (Santa Maria Maggiore) so it's easy to quickly locate on a map or get directions to. Walking distance to the colosseum. The other sites were a bit further away, but we were able to do our entire trip without ever taking a cab or any public transportation. (The metro is very close if you did want to use it though.) The breakfast was nice on the rooftop terrace. Pastries, yogurt, cookies/crackers. It was the same everyday so might get tiring after more than 3 days. Complimentary hot beverages were good also, though sometimes hard to communicate with the waitress who didn't seem to speak much English. She was nice and attentive enough though. The room itself was basic, but nice. Nice TV, clean bathroom, comfortable enough bed. There was a fair amount of street noise and occasional sirens since it's on a big street, but it was better with the window and the shade fully closed. The concierge was helpful and friendly. They let us leave our luggage for the day after we checked out and also recommended a good restaurant for our first night. Overall, definitely a good value for the money. I would stay there again or recommend it to friends for a tourist trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel -Amazin Location”
Reviews.Author: Vishal111
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nyts.Hotel is just in the centre of the city,prettty close from the Metro station (5-10 min).While the rooms were pretty compact, it was very neat n clean.Smallest bathroom i had ever seen, littl difficult for guys especially if you are tall But overall enjoyed our stay.Hop on Hop off stop was just on the opposite road.Good area nearby with lot of restaurants....Worth the price considering the location. Our bus starting point for Capri was also just minutes from here.If in ROME, would suggest not to miss the Capri tour & specially the "BLUE GRUTTO"

Reviews.Title: “do not get a room facing the road!”
Reviews.Author: MrsRMA
Reviews.Content: this hotel is friendly and clean, the rooms are a good size except for the bathroom the shower is tiny and im not a big person. If you dont like listening to the incessant roar of traffic from a very busy main road then ask for a room facing the other side of the building. We had to change rooms as i could not sleep even with the windows closed which was extremely stuffy and hot when the weather warmed up and the hotel refused to put the aircon on stating they were not allowed by government ruling until april 15th, however i doubt this as top hotels have theirs on as guests are paying lots of $$$$. Would try to find a better location than this hotel in a quieter area.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location lovely weekend.”
Reviews.Author: MartiQ
Reviews.Content: great location for all sites, close to termini. hotel staff were helpful, especially when hubby needed early breakfast for marathon. breakfast basic but enough to set up up for the day.....after all there is a lot of ice cream and pizza to eat!!!! lift to our 5th floor room was so funny..... tight squeeze to say the least ( dont eat too much of that ice cream i mentioned earlier or you will not fit!). reception sorted a taxi for us back to the airport and were helpful with general directions to get around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: BournemouthPlusone
Reviews.Content: The Doria is a great value three-star hotel in a convenient location, close to the station and within walking distance of most of Rome's main sights. Staff were incredibly friendly and helpful, and rooms are of a really good standard given the price. The hotel is situated on a busy main road so the location is a little noisy, but shutters and triple glazing mean noise from the street is substantially reduced. A lovely, friendly hotel that's perfect for a cheap and cheerful visit to the Eternal City!

Reviews.Title: “Never stay here”
Reviews.Author: Annongalway
Reviews.Content: At least faulty towers was funny. there was nothing funny about this place at all. !) the staff were very ignoranat except for one older man with glasses who was nice. i wanted to bring a friend up to see how small my room was and the man at the desk wouldnt let him they made me pay up front i came in late often (2.30 am) as i was having a good time on holidays and the door man made a point of saying that i was the last one in. i thought i was paying for the room for 24 hours and should be allowed in when i liked. 2) the cleaning staff made an awafull racket every day from about 7m to 12noon. there was no "please do not disturb" notice on the door and there was someone knocking on my door every morning i had to go and look for toilet paper after the 3rd day-there was only half a roll there when i arrived 3) there wasnt hot water in the shower on any occasion i tried to use it there was a smell of sewage in the room

Reviews.Title: “Elena, Moscow”
Reviews.Author: Elena1405
Reviews.Content: The hotel as a whole was pleasant. Convenient enough arrangement, isn't far from the basic sights.Rooms are small, but cozy enough. However the unfriendly relation of the personnel categorically wasn't pleasant. At an extract from hotel our things have taken out from number without our consent, have shouted that late we come and have told that after 11 o'clock in the morning, we are not a guest any more... It is sad that in the most beautiful and such romantic city of the world there are such ugly employees of hotel. Never any more to a train in this hotel and to you I do not advise

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and good location.”
Reviews.Author: skihorton
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights and although the shower and toilet were a little small, by Rome standards this hotel was more than acceptable. The staff were always pleasant and helpfull and it was close to many icons. We were able to walk to 90 percent of Rome's attractions and we are in our sixties.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ADW55
Reviews.Content: Just back from doria and thought it was very good for the price we paid. Close to station which we liked as we used the metro quite a bit. Very clean, good size room ,shower and lift very small but not a problem. Lots of people thought towels hard but i found them good cotton dried you very well.The roof top garden was lovely for breakfast,overall i thought it a great little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The smallest shower ever!”
Reviews.Author: moneypenny78
Reviews.Content: Good location within walking distance to many sights. There are metro stations nearby and a large grocery store too. The room was large, but the shower was so small that you couldn't bend down when inside. The furniture seemed a little dirty too. The roof-top patio breakfast was good; pastries, cereal, yogurt, etc. The staff was hit-and-miss; sometimes we were greeted warmly by one person, and other times it seemed like we were inconveniencing them.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Transportation-friendly, Adequate Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lsg5021
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Doria for seven nights. My trip to Rome was a college graduation trip with my friend to see the sights and explore the nightlife there. We quickly realized that we were not the typical guests at the hotel when we returned at around 2am the first night and ours were the only keys left at the front desk. The hotel definitely had a small inn feel and was better suited for couples. I would separate the following list into pros and cons but it all depends on your own preferences: -Very convenient to the Termini station (only a couple blocks away) if you feel comfortable enough to use public transportation -Quiet neighborhood -Old school key system as opposed to cards -Breakfast was adequate -Friendly staff (they speak English) -Small elevator, I used the stairs -Housekeeping leaves midday Overall, it was a decent hotel. I was neither impressed nor disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “v v small room”
Reviews.Author: sanayaIndia
Reviews.Content: we stayed in rome for 2 nights .. hotel wise its a v average hotel... the lift is jus to small n so r the bathrooms.. rooms r also small n interior not exciting......if u only luking at putting ur bags n being out the whole day ..this place will work for u.. best part is that its diagonally across the main church n you can take the sight seeing tour right outside your hotel...there are some really good eating joints right down ... you have to pay for the internet connection which does not work in the room.. we had to take the laptop down to the reception area to get connected... the lift is so mall tht only 2 people can stand if you have luggage on you its v difficult as only 1 bag n 1 person n stand.. the breakfast room is v v congested n brksft is v average service was gud but for the price you pay.. u can hunt for other hotels nearby.. if budget is a problem then u can stick to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: BROWNGW1
Reviews.Content: Having seen lots of positive reviews on this hotel we were not let down. The hotel was in a great location, about a 5-10 minute walk to the Coloseum. 5 minute walk to the termini train station. On the way in we shared a cab with another couple - it was 45 euros. On the way out we got the leonardo express. this was great. always goes from platform 25 every half hour. was 11 euros. Remember to validate your ticket in the little yellow boxes on the platform other wise they can charge you more. Took 30 mins to get to airport. would highly reccomend. Hotel was lovely, very clean. had new towels etc everyday. No kettle in room but surrounded by coffee shops! Breakfast was nice, lots of pastries, cereal etc. Great view from breaky room over Rome. There is someone on reception 24 hrs a day so we left our keys with them whenever we went out. Overall really lovely trip, great hotel, location and we are already planning a return visit!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutly fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Noonaa
Reviews.Content: I got back from Rome yesterday and stayed at the Hotel Doria for 3 nights and it was fantastic! The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, the room was a really good size, clean and the bed was nice and firm (but not like a plank of wood). The bathroom looked brand new and was also very clean. The breakfast was lovely with a variety of things to eat like croissants, cereal, hams, cheeses and toast. This hotel is perfectly situated in Rome, 5 minutes walk from the Termini Station and with all the major sights only about 10-20 minutes away, except for Vatican City which took us a leisurely 45 minutes to walk too. You also have St Maria Maggiora right on your door step, which is a beautiful Basilica you must go and visit. Even though this hotel is on a major road and our room was facing a small courtyeard to the back we heard no street noise what so ever, even when we had the windows open. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to stay in Rome, I’m certainly going back!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location! Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: andrea_santos623
Reviews.Content: Hotel Doria was a great hotel! The location was great and was in walking distance to everything! It is with in 5 mins walking distance from the station. On your first day get a roma pass this will give u free metro and bus rides for a few days also 2 free entry to any musseum of your choice apart from the vatican. Rome is very easy to get around and see, make sure you have comfurtable shoes on as like us we walked almost every where. The hotel is fantastic, its a small room but enough for a few nights! Towels are very thin so bring your own although saying that my partner found them ok! The breakfast in the morning is very nice too! At night time if you would like to chill in your room bring some entrtainment i.e cards, dvd player, book as the tv all the channels were if italian which is the only fault in the hotel but half the time we were too tired to watch tv anyway!!! Overall Lovely , friendly and great location!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Small but good value for money”
Reviews.Author: dun0s
Reviews.Content: Hotel Doria was a pleasure to stay in for our week long holiday to Rome. We had a double room for the two of us. Here are the key points: Friendly staff always ready with a smile Towels (2 hand, 2 body) changed daily. The towels are thin but work fine. Bed linen changed once during the week WiFi is available for an additional fee Shower was small, about 3/4 the size of a standard UK shower cubicle. Room and en-suite cleaned daily Double bed was two singles pushed together Breakfast (7.30 to 9.30am) was standard continental including croissants, rolls, yogurts, ham, cheeses, cereal, juice, coffee, etc. Air conditioned room TV in room with Italian channels only Mini bar fridge with space for your own drinks Small room safe with user-set combination lock (about A5 size) 7 minutes walk from Termini station You can see the Colosseum from the roof terrace!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect basecamp”
Reviews.Author: UrbanSuper
Reviews.Content: Price: NOK 2.600 (4 nights incl. breakfast) Located by Santa Maria Maggiore, wich is about 5 min. walk from Termini station, it's not the fanciest area in Rome, but that's reflected in the price. On the other hand, Rome city center is not a big area so all major sights are within walking distance. And of course with Termini close by, cheap public transportation is easy accessable. Standard room; very well soundproofed, A/C, minibar, no international news channels on the tv. Standard continental breakfast, also bread, salami, cheese. Dining area at nice top floor terrace. Polite staff, area for baggage storage, small elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but dirty toilet”
Reviews.Author: PepperLaGatta
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Doria for 5 nights in July 2009. The hotel is in a really great location. The staff was super friendly and chatty. The breakfast room was nice. I just had cereal, juice and apple sauce. The waitress in the breakfast room was super nice. The elevator is incredibly small that I could barely fit me and my one suitcase. My room was ok. I had a single room that I mainly used for sleeping, bathing and keeping my luggage. The floor had carpeting. My view from the window was of a garden and another building. The room had a nice twin size bed, a desk with a television on top, a mini bar underneath the desk, and a spacious closet with a small safe inside of it. Whenever I wanted to recharge my cellphone and camera battery, I had to leave the light switch on because the power outlet didn't work without it on. The bathroom didn't have a bidet but that wasn't my biggest problem with the bathroom. My biggest problem with the bathroom was the mold and stains in the toilet. It was so gross. There was mold in the shower too. The shower was somewhat spacious than other hotels I have been to in Italy. The other reviewers on here were right about the towels. The hotel offered 3 towels. One was a regular hand towel. The other two were different from towels that I've seen and used. One was like table cloth and the other had a checkered texture kind of like a breakfast table cloth. But all the towels were clean and did the job of drying. The bathroom was supplied with 4 shampoo packets, 2 shower caps, and 2 small bars of soap.

Reviews.Title: “a central hotel”
Reviews.Author: thewool
Reviews.Content: stayed at the doria hotel 27th 28th may 2009. the hotel is very central 15mins walk downhill to the collessium and other major sights but there is a hop on/off bus stop 1min walk away ,we got the 48 hour pass at 18 euro each [ you will need it for the vatican spanish steps ect] you can get this through the hotel or at the bus stop. the rooms are cleaned every day ,the shower is on the small side and take youre own towel as they supply you with a cotton sheet. breakfast is continental and the coffee comes in a jug , but get the lift as it is a hike to the top... the reception is manned 24 hours a day .. although it is on a main road once you have closed the windows traffic noise is minnimal...food wise rome can be expensive and the beer pricey .. all in all a good central hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Finvalent
Reviews.Content: Me and my mom decided to book a room in Hotel Doria because of it's location close to everything, reasonable price and the mostly positive reviews of it. And we were not dissappointed, hotel Doria was absolutely perfect place to stay. It was close to almost everything and if you want to go further, the Termini station is just two blocks away which makes it also very easily accessible from Fiumicino airport. The Hotel staff was great, friendly and helpfull and spoke good english. The rooms were very clean by any standard and were cleaned every day. In the room everything from shower to TV functioned perfectly and we had no problems with anything. The only downsides were the quite hard bed and noise from the street, though neither bothered us in the least. The breakfast was also very tasty and diverse, there wasn't any fresh fruit or stuff like backon but almost everything else you could want. Overall Hotel Doria made our holiday as perfect as it was. It was very homely and welcoming, it was great to have a "home" in Rome where we could return after a hard day of sightseeing. Absolutely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: italyfan98
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my time at this hotel. From the moment i walked in the staff at reception made me feel welcome. Which is something that is lacking in most hotels these days. The breakfast was huge and was served coffee by a lovely lady. Staff at reception were very helpful and made sure i had all the information i needed for a great stay in Roma. Rooms were very comfortable and warm. bathrooms are a little small, but thats the only complaint i had. Overall a very nice hotel. I will definitely return

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed!”
Reviews.Author: maryedN_ireland
Reviews.Content: Hotel Doria is a small but comfortable hotel. When you are only using it as a base, then it meets all your needs. The room was small, and the en suite even smaller! If you are a "big" person, you may have problems fitting into the shower! The breakfast was basic but tasty and I thought the coffee was lovely! The staff were very friendly and helpful, and the Hotel was about a 20 minute walk from the Colosseum. If you want a basic but comfortable Hotel, then the Hotel Doria will suit you.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service, loved it!”
Reviews.Author: jayce87
Reviews.Content: What a great little hotel and its just a skip and a hop from the main train station. I found the reception to be incredibly helpful and friendlly and the continental breakfast that they had on the rooftop to be sustainable and breathtaking. Rooms were on the traditional side (if not a little tacky), but their cleaning standards are really up to scratch (compared to most hotels I've stayed in Italy) and they're not fussed if you ask for a few more towels. Come for the service, stay for the breakfast on the rooftop with a view of Rome. Definitely will be staying there again when Im back in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Easy Access to Termini”
Reviews.Author: Overseez
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for three nights mainly on the positive TripAdvisor reviews. I think the reviews have mentioned many of the good things: The location is an easy five minute walk from the Termini, even with heavy luggage, and the loc is pretty good for local fare down Via Merulana or into the trendy Monti area. The Metro A line (Vic Emman stop) is three minutes away, and on a hot day (the cars have AC) was a great way to get into the centre quick. The breakfast buffet on the roof in good weather is a very relaxing way to start the day. And the room was clean and comfortable. But I must say the bathroom was exceptionally small. Both of us had to put our toiletry bag beside the bed. The shower was unimaginably tight, really really awkward (I'm 6 ft/185 cm and 180 pounds, so not huge but not tiny). I really felt like I was stepping into an isolation tank or about to be cryogencially frozen. There was also a huge honking blow-dryer taking up one wall in the cubicle bathroom which we bashed ourselves against over and over. But, again, very nice room, air conditioned, with good soundproofing and a flat screen TV. We left our luggage there for six hours on checkout day in a locked closet and really appreciated that. For short stays I would recommend it, but for longer stays I think you might need a bit more space.

Reviews.Title: “Does the job well”
Reviews.Author: GrahamandMeg
Reviews.Content: 5 minute walk from Termini station with easy access to most of central Rome. The Doria is a small but very good hotel for a 1 or 2 night stay. It's basic however very clean and with a nice roof top breakfast you can see the top of the Colosseum. There were no toiletries which we found strange and would have liked some soap which you kind of expect. Not sure if this was an oversight or not and we were only there 1 night so we didn't mention it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: trixie68
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a very very wet but wonderful three days in Rome. We arrived after at the Doira Hotel after a lot of aggrevation with transfersfrom Ciampino airport (TERRAVISION-Rome council had impounded all the coaches the day we arrived so had to make our own way to Hotel via bus and metro and same on return). We had been up since 2.30am so arrived at the Doria very tired .The Hotel was very easy to find and in a great location. Unfortunately, there appeared to be a problem when we finally arrived at the hotel. A mistake had been made (by staff not us) and would my husband and I do the manager a favour and take two single room for the night. Well, we had booked a double room (since 8th Jan) and I was distraught! It was our 10th wedding anniversary and also my 40th so we had planned this trip for months only to be told we would have to spend the night apart. I'm sorry to say but I burst into tears. After a long trip, trouble with the coach and then this it was too much. I thought the trip was ruined at that point and I'm sorry to say it but why us? Anyway, the Manager saw how upset I had become and out of nothing a double room had appeared!!! To say I was pleased was an understatement but how come it had come to this?? The room was comfortable,very clean and the breakfast was lovely-as was the lady who looked after it all. I know this is meant to be a hotel review but we loved Rome despite the rain and we will be back!!! By the way, the night before we left we saw The Pope when he went to Santa Maria Maggiore for Corpus Christi! Talk about timing!

Reviews.Title: “Proposed to in Doria”
Reviews.Author: suzieb78
Reviews.Content: I just had to write a review (even though its 2 years later) I stayed in this hotel in Feb 2006 for 5 nights. I have to say it is a lovely 'little' hotel. The rooms are basic but comfortable and clean. The bathroom is tiny but manageable... and the shower is even tinier!!! but it all adds to the charm. The staff were lovely and helpful. The hotel is located within an easy walk to nearly all the usual attractions, Colleseum, Pallintine Hill, Trevi Fountain etc.. and its not far from the main train station either which is great. The Theatre is not far from here and although it doesnt look like much from the outside (grey concrete) it is absolutely amazing on the inside... although my italy is only very basic and i didnt really understand the opera but it was an experience!! Me and my partner went there as a valentines treat... after he proposed in our room in Hotel Doria... yes i know all the lovely scenic places and he chose the hotel!!! haha! (took a while to get the nerve up!) but even that was lovely cos the staff were so sweet treatting us like royality for the rest of the evening. There is a cafe around the corner and oh boy!! they do the most fabulous pastries and Gelatis i have ever had... am glad only went in on the last day other wise would not have fit back on the plane. All in all it is a lovely little hotel and is convenient to all the sights. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “would stay again”
Reviews.Author: coc0007
Reviews.Content: As I am very paticular where we stay while on holiday this hotel ticked all the boxes lovely and clean rooms well mantained and nice and warm as in november when we stayed perfect location and good price we booked direct with hotel as some sites told us it was full on the dates we wanted so worth asking direct . ann and Ian,wetherby ,Yorkshire

Reviews.Title: “Good little hotel”
Reviews.Author: birdette
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in November 2007. I should have written this review a little earlier, sorry. Here are some pictures, enjoy! Here is how I would break it down: GOOD: * Location, very close to the main station * Good service * Nice breakfast, which we really enjoyed * Rooms were nice and sufficient * The beautiful church across the street * There is a grocery store right around the corner next to the make-up store. You have to go down the stair but its got everything. NOT SO GOOD (I don’t want to say bad because I don’t think it was bad) * Street noise, but from what I hear that’s for most hotels in Rome * Towels were very thin, not sure if they even were towels * Shower was very small but useable * Tiny elevator so get ready to walk up those stairs. The question is, would I stay at Hotel Doria again? Probably yes I would. (A word of advice, don’ bother eating at the restaurant that is facing the church, it’s overpriced. After being in Italy for over a week that was the only overpriced meal we had, and it wasn’t that good).

Reviews.Title: “rome a walkers paradise”
Reviews.Author: johnnyboyandkells
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was in a very good location , close to termini and in walking distance to all the major attractions. We had read some reviews about the hotel before we left and all the coments on the bathrooms are true! However the hotel is in an old 1880's building as are most in this area and i suppose most of the hotels are similar.Saying that the hotel was very clean if a little dated,but we hadnt paid lots of money so I guess you get what you pay for. The hotel served as a good base to visit Rome and the city is Fantastic .all the attractions are well priced but you do get the felling that the tourist is getting ripped off by restaurants , bars etc. It does get a bit tedious paying stupid prices for a couple of beers! The best quality and priced meal we had was in a chinese restuarant ! However much money you thought you would think you need to take ....... double it , As time there passed we did get the knack of finding more sensibly priced food and drink . We found out about a pass you can buy that gains you entrance to all the attractions as well as transport but if was too late for us.This maybe worth investigating. From the airport ,make sure if you are using a taxi that you get an official roma taxi which charge 30 euro's from airport to rome. we got stung on the way in 60 euro's but paid 30 on the way back. would recommend Rome , a fantastic place , the history is something else , but beware its london on speed ! john and kelly

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel Doria”
Reviews.Author: AnneLondon_UK
Reviews.Content: I've just come back from a week in Rome, staying at the Hotel Doria and I found the room I was given extremely comfortable, albeit the shower (no bath) is small. I'm of medium build and not tall but I found it difficult to move around easily without knocking my elbows. The hotel generally is small. However, that is just one minus against the pluses in its favour. The hotel is in a good location, just by Santa Maria Maggiore Church. I did not need to use public transport. I walked everywhere. The staff there were extremely pleasant and helpful. The hotel was clean and my room, as I say, was comfortable. Breakfast was on the sixth floor and there was a terrace where you could sit outside if you wanted to. Breakfast was contintental, nothing extravagant, nothing cooked, but for me it was perfect. All in all I would definitely stay at the Doia again if I returned to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very Decent”
Reviews.Author: kimz92684
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here one night so we didn't get to experience all the hotel has to offer. The room itself was clean and comfortable. The host was nice but when we needed to leave early for our flight, the host was difficult to find. In hindsight, we should have said something the night before. Overall, I would stay here again, it had good location and was a good price. It was perfect for getting to the train station early in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MDtravelers3
Reviews.Content: Quaint hotel - GREAT LOCATION!! It's a 7 minute walk to Roma Termini train station (where you can catch trains, buses, taxis, etc). The rooms are CLEAN!! Maids come daily to clean it and keep it spotless. Rooms are small, bathrooms are smaller :) but very clean and with all amenities - haridryer, shampoos/soaps, etc. My husband is 6ft tall and he managed ok for 4 days with the tiny shower. There's a decent size closet in the room with an ironing board and extra pillows and sheets. Ofcourse the phones are outdated a bit - no touch tone phones there. Beds are comfortable. Just keep the windows closed at night and that should keep most of the noise out. But you will get up when the church bells ring in the morning :) Breakfast is served up until 9:30 on the rooftop which is great. Staff is pleasant. Some cannot speak a word of English but usually someone is available that does. Elevator is TINY, can only fit two people if they're relatively avg weight. Stairs are no problem. There are 2 GREAT cafes near the hotel. One is right across the street (has great gelato!!) and one is right around the corner as you head towards Roma Termini - we ate there almost every night. Food is delicious!! Would definitely stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Burnbaby
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in the Doria on our trip to Rome. The reception area is very small, and the lift is tiny & quaint, so we went for the stairs! The room was a decent size, have stayed in much smaller. it was clean, and the maid came every day to make bed, change towels, etc. The view from our window was nice, overlooked a pretty courtyard. The bathroom was tiny, but you make do. I'm a 5' 4" woman, and was forever hitting my elbows on the screen when I showered! Would be awful for a tall man! The room had air-con of sorts, which was nice because it was quite hot when we went, and there is a lot of traffic noise, all night as well as during the day. Seemed to be a lot of police sirens!! Breakfast on the rooftop terrace was a fab start to the day, really lovely. Good choice of food, and we always had plenty to eat. The Doria doesn't, however, have a restaurant or bar. Not a big deal really, given all the bars & restaurants around. We had some fab meals out every evening, not far from the hotel. The walk to the colloseum was OK, not that far, something like 20 mins, I think. The underground station was near enough, so used that to travel to the Vatican. The staff on reception were always friendly, and always greeted us as we left for the day/came back. I would recommend the Doria. I would say good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great little place”
Reviews.Author: loublue
Reviews.Content: great little hotel at a great price!! its not 5 star, so dont expect that and you will really love this hotel. Location is great - we walked everywhere. After reading reviews on this site, I was a bit worried about finding it, but armed with a map from the hotel website we were fine. If its not raining or cold, enjoying breakfast on the rooftop terrace makes an excellent start to the day. Yes, the bathroom and shower are small, but has everything you need. The lift has to be seen to be believed, but once again, serves its purpose well

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the price”
Reviews.Author: jessybobs
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with the Doria and could not fault it apart from the busy road outside ( which is very common in Rome ) but the traffic noise ( that went on all night ) was drowned out by the double glazing. Staff were excellent and very friendly. Our room looked on to the Basilica Santa Maria Maggiore and it was lovely to wake up to the church bells, as I said the area was very busy and the roads took a bit of practice to cross !! There were plenty of buses and taxis across the street, also an open top bus left every hour from outside the basilica. About 20 minutes walk to the Colosseum down Via Cavour, other sights Trevi and Pantheon were about another 15mins up Via del Corso. including stopping and looking time. The room was a decent size, ( i've stayed in much smaller in Italy ) very clean, the maids visited everyday. Bathroom was small but very well equipped modern and spotless. Yes, the shower was small but al least it had a screen, our last hotel in Rome was just a "wetroom" ( just don't drop the soap as its hard to bend to pick it up !) Also had a hairdryer. Breakfast was lovely, plenty of selection of rolls, croisants cereals, juice etc, typical continental fare and unlmited coffee and hot chocolate. The waitress serving coffee was lovely, The terrace had a lovely view over the roof tops of Rome,with the Colosseum towering above, a breathtaking sight. It was a little chilly to have breakfast on the terrace as it was in the shade early in the morning ( March ) Overall would definately stay at the Doria again, we paid only a £100 for a 3 night stay through Cresta Holidays, suberb value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Base for sight seeing”
Reviews.Author: NicNottingham
Reviews.Content: We only got lost once when walking from Termini to the Hotel Doria, and it took about 25 minutes with getting lost. If we had got straight there it would have been 10 minutes. If you were walking from Termin you need to go to the left hand side of the Santa Maria Majorie Church. The area around there is really nice and there is a great supermarket. On arrival we were greeted by a lovely reception, and well presented and clean rooms. The decor was elegant, and we were surprised by how nice it was for what we paid. The bathroom was well equiped with all you would need, but a little cosy. There was a bit of a knack needed for getting on the loo. There were four of us in two rooms, and the other bathroom was laid out differently to ours, and no where near as cosy. The location was great as you were away from the main tourist area's but in short walking distance to a lot of places. There was a taxi rank 100 yards from the hotel and there were always taxi's there. The Breakfast was very plesant, in a nice little breakfast room at the top of the Hotel. There were cearal, rolls and coisants, breakfast bars, hot and cold drinks. All in all what you would expect from a quaint little hotel. I would reccomend the Hotel Doria, and we had a great time, and would definately return there.

Reviews.Title: “Dishonest Disaster”
Reviews.Author: DeanDave
Reviews.Content: After a lot of research, we were delighted to book our room at the Hotel Doria. But when we arrived on Friday evening, we were told that we had no room due to a water pipe burst but they had booked us a room at another hotel. This hotel was inferior, on the other side of the Termini Station and we had specifically chosen this hotel due to its location away from the station. I asked to see the room to confirm that it was a water issue but was told the manager had no key. After refusing to leave the lobby, and basically throwing a fit, the owner called and continued to claim it was a plumbing issue. We had been warned of this sort of thing, and after asking other residents about water issues, it became clear we were being lied to. Eventually, the owner admitted that he was lying but that on Friday evening there was nothing to do, and not being able to find another room, we had to settle for the other room. It was a terrible way to start an Italian vacation. David

Reviews.Title: “Very Cute & Clean”
Reviews.Author: Kyrarini
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights coming from Athens Greece we found Doria hotel excellent if you don't expect deluxe service from a 3* hotel of course! The room was warm & very clean with a window overlooking Via Merulana & Santa Maria Maggiore (wonderful church) which is noisy but there 3 series of windows/shutters and once you close them you don't hear any noise. The lift is tiny, 2 small sized persons can just fit in there but we found it very cute and funny! The area is excellent and very safe, we had absolutely no problem walking back to the hotel late at night. We never used the metro or the bus, we walked everywhere even to the Vatican city, Trastevere, Piazza Navona, Quirinale, Fontana di Trevi, Pantheon, Piazza di Spagna, Via Veneto, Villa Borghese etc. Rome is not that big so you don't really need the transports if you enjoy walking. The best way to explore Rome is to walk as it's such an amazing city full of sightseeings and attractions that you may miss if you use transports. From Termini station take the Via Cavour which will lead you just behind the Santa Maria Maggiore. Via Merulana is just facing the front side of Santa Maria Maggiore. It's a 10 minute walk to Termini and very easy to locate the hotel if you can read a map. Breakfast was continental buffet with a big variety of things to eat, try the hot chocolate - it's delicious! The Breakfast room is tiny but you can eat outside on the small terrace surrounded by flowers. Staff is excellent and very helpful, all receptionists & the lady serving breakfast are so gentle & polite. I would go back to Doria hotel. We loved it! Antonios & Niki from Athens

Reviews.Title: “Quaint hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: minniegirl
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after reading the reviews on this site and was not disappointed. Close to the Termini train station, it was very convenient as we arrived and departed Rome by train. Extremely friendly people at the front desk - very helpful in answering questions and booking us reservations at the Borghese. Very cute rooftop terrace for breakfast, although it happened to be raining our first morning there so we instead ate breakfast in the somewhat cramped breakfast room. My only two possible complaints - the breakfast was a little lacking compared to what we had in hotels in Florence and Sorrento and the shower was very tiny. I am a 5'7" woman and had trouble moving around in the shower - I can't imagine what a 6'2" man would do! In addition to proximity to the train station, we were able to walk to the Colosseum/Ancient Rome and there were several little cafes nearby for lunch or dinner. But all in all, a wonderful hotel for the price - I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “small and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Bee46
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on previous tripadvisor reviews. As we intended to take the train from the airport - an express taking about 25 mins and costing 9.50 euros each way , great value - we wanted somewhere near the station so that we could walk to the hotel. It can be difficult to find without a map - so make sure you have one beforehand! Cannot fault the hotel - room was looking out on to the Via Merulana, which is busy and noisy, but was not a problem at all -although might be in hot weather with the windows wide open if you are a light sleeper. Staff very friendly and helpful, especially the man on reception who spoke excellent English. Bathroom spotless and yes, very tiny, but if you know beforehand you can have a good laugh - shower cubicle was a good size however and no problem. As others have mentioned it is not a really central hotel but the Colosseum and Forum are only 15 minutes walk away and Trevi Fountain and Pantheon not much over half an hour - and you see so much more when you walk! Area around Termini is a bit seedy, but we had no difficulties, and the area near the hotel seemed very safe at night. Excellent value for money - we were very happy with the location and if you wish to see all the main sites then whereever you are in the city one or two of them are not going to be on your doorstep. Enjoy - we did!

Reviews.Title: “A Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gorgon-Z
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Doria was a pleasant place to stay and not far from many of the major tourist attractions of Rome. The concierge was very helpful, the rooms were quite small but clean and the continental breakfast was excellent. The ensuite bathroom in Room 103 is very small and the tiny showers have to be seen to be believed! The elevator is also amusingly small and not one you would enter with someone you didn't know very well :) Road noise was minimal thanks to double-glazed windows and the air conditioning made the summer temperatures bearable. When looking for places to eat steer well clear of the Antico Caffe Santamaria (around the corner from the hotel) as the service, prices and quality of food were abysmal and the place was dirty and full of flies! The only reason we ate there was we hadn't slept for 48 hours and wanted a quick snack before having a rest (i.e. we were desperate!). Another place to avoid is the nearby restaurant Tempio di Mecenate which served the worst pizza we have ever eaten (hardly anything on it). If you are looking for a reasonably-priced place to grab a snack and a drink (alcohol, soft drink, coffee etc.) we would strongly recommend Bar Do Brasil (turn left out of hotel and it is down the first or second left laneway). This place was frequented by local people, had great service and was well priced. There is also a great little pizza place called Pizza Republica which is just down the road from the hotel (turn left and follow your nose). All in all we would recommend the Hotel Doria as a good place to stay when visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Rose_James
Reviews.Content: The hotel Doria was a charming, quiet hotel; the staff were very pleasant and helpful at all times. The rooms were clean and comfortable with air conditioning. The en suite had a shower, toilet and basin and while it was small it was clean, the space was well used and nicely decorated. I was concerned before going about the street noise but closing the French windows significantly reduced the street noise and did not interfere with a good nights sleep! Breakfast is on the roof upstairs which is provides lovely views of the city and the cold buffet is basic but filling and plentiful. Location wise the hotel had some lovely restaurants near by and was roughly a ten minute walk to the Coliseum, over all Rome was much more compact than we had anticipated and it didn’t' t take long to walk past the metro stops! The most convenient stop for the hotel is arguably Vittoria Emanuel which is just around the corner, plenty of ice cream shops to tempt you on the way! We found getting off at the Termini was a far longer walk. I would definitely stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Lovely”
Reviews.Author: gaynor74
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the Hotel Doria. It got off to a bad start as we simply could not find the Hotel. It is not 250 metres as some websites state from the Termini Station. It is about a 10 minute walk (that is if you walk in the right direction!) We unfortunately walked for 1hour 30 mins trying to find Hotel. In the end we had to ask a lovely Italian lady where the street was. As she could not speak English nor we Italian, she went out of her way and took us directly to the street. We would probably never have found it. Just shows there are still some nice people around. The best description I could give is from the Termini station which has 4 entrances (that is where we went wrong!) get yourself to the front entrance of the Santa Maria Marjorie Church, from the Church entrance, facing away from the entrance, there are two long streets leading away and it is the street towards your right-hand side. After this fiasco things soon picked up for the better. The Hotel was simply lovely. Small reception area with pleasant staff. Agreed with the other posts about the lift being very very small (quite cute though), luckily we were only on the first floor and just carried our cases up. We had Room 103 which overlooked the main street. Very clean and comfortable. Again agree about the shower being small but it was spotless and brand new fittings throughout the bathroom. Breakfast again very pleasant, basic continental fayre but still enjoyable – lovely hot chocolate. We were lucky enough to sit outside on the terrace for breakfast each morning (jumper necessary) as the weather was starting to warm up in Rome. The only thing I would change if I were being critical was to move the Hotel slightly nearer the main sites but it is still a really good base but I suppose the nearer you are the more expensive. It was about 15 mins to Coliseum not bad and Trevi Fountain about 30 mins walk. On an evening there were plenty of nearby restaurants but we preferred the Pantheon area which was again about a 30 mins walk but a return taxi only cost us 7 euros. The Terravison bus from the airport is great, very cheap and reliable and was £9.50 return. I booked this Hotel after reading the previous reviews and hopefully my review will help others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Found the Hotel on a discount website after trailing through all accomodation websites. Read the great comments on Trip Advisor and made the booking. It turned out to be a fantastic hotel and great vale for money. The location was excellent as only 5 minutes from Train Station where the airport bus left us so there was not the hassle of hunting for the hotel for long. 10 mins to the Colloseum, and loads of restaraunts round the corner on Via Di S. Maria Maggiore. On which there is the best restaraunt we found where after 8pm a Pianist comes in and plays for the rest of the night. The food there was the best although more expensive but worth it for the added bonus of a great atmosphere. Unfortunately cant remember the name but look for the piano through the window! Breakfast in the hotel was simple but nice and the Waitress was very plesant. A tip, go before 8.30am as you will likely have to wait for a seat as the Breakfast room is very small and unfortunately we could not eat out on the Sun Terrace as was raining every day!! We were lucky enough to get room 201 which has the only balcony looking out over the street onto the Maggiore Church. Fair sized room, immaculate with small but nice bathroom. The high temperature in the room was fixed by just switching the air conditioing off as the window open would have been too noisy from the street below. Great hotel in great location, highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Good Base Camp”
Reviews.Author: catack
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Doria was an average place to stay on our recent four night break in Rome. Rooms were very clean and the location of the hotel is perfect to get around the city on foot. The bathroom was VERY, VERY small, even by city hotel standards, and the shower was almost not usable, it was smaller than 3' square - didn't give much room to wash your hair! My other disappointment with our stay was that our room was on the street side of the building. This meant that noise from the road was really loud, especially as we had to have our window open at night because the heating was on high throughout the building, as it was February when we visited. With the window closed it was obviously a bit quieter, but not much as the bus stopped right outside our room. Having said all that, location counts and for the price we paid per night we got a good base camp for our short trip. If I was to stay in Rome again, I would probably pay a bit more money and stay somewhere else. But, for around $85 (US) a night, it was a good choice. If you stay here or visit the Basilica, visit the wonderful deli/cafe around the corner of the hotel, Antico Caffe Santmaria - great little find for a quick bite before heading out for a days sightseeing or a late night drink and dessert.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hearny66
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from two nights in Rome, stopping at the Doria Hotel. The hotel is lovely, it is immaculately clean and nicely decorated, there is plenty of choice for breakfast. I have read before that the lift is possibly the smallest in the country, I would have to agree with this however, it was not a problem, my husband and myself could both fit in (just) as long as we did not have any luggage - and if you are taking your luggage up you can just take turns - all in all I would thoroughly recommend the Doria for being a lovely, clean, good priced hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hoel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had searched the internet for a reasonable priced hotel which was handy for all the attractions and the underground. We eventually found it in the Doria. The hotel was very clean and tidy, tastefully decorated, if you like green, and the staff were always very friendly and accommodating. We arrived at about 11.30 at night and were slightly concerned whether our room would still be there, even though we had faxed the hotel to advise our time of arrival. But we had no need to worry. The breakfasts are very good, continental. You can eat as much as you need and we also took some for snacks as we toured the city. When breakfasting you can get a marvellous view of the upper reaches of the colisseum. The only drawback was the size of the shower. It was less then 500mm square and didnt leave a lot of room. Other than that the bathroom was okay. The hotel is very handy for the main station and easy walking distance to the subway and colisseum. Overall a wee diamond of a find.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After trawling the internet for a reasonably priced hotel in Rome, we decided on the Doria. What a find! the room was spotless, the staff very helpful and friendly and it was situated in a nice area within walking distance of all the main attractions (although, unlike us, you may want to get a bus or the metro to and from the Vatican!). There were nice restaurants in the vicinity in which to eat, just ask at the reception and they will recommend reasonably priced restaurants for you. Try the hop on, hop off tour bus which leaves from the church right near the hotel, it will take you to all the places of interest. We loved everything about Rome and will certainly be back (we through the coins in the fountain) and we will definately be staying at the Doria Hotel when we come. ps I will also recommend it to my friends

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay at the Doria”
Reviews.Author: gracie68
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Doria Hotel for 5 days in late September and early October. The hotel was clean and comfortable. There is a bus stop right outside the front door that will take you to the train station to connect with busses all over Rome. Or, the hotel is close enough to walk to the Termini. Nice location very near to Santa Maria Maggiore and close to St John Lateran. Adequate, but not special breakfast. Outdoor breakfast area is special but the indoor area very small. VERY small elevator. If you have large bags, be sure to reserve a lower floor. Noisy street but double paned windows screen out the traffic noise. Concierge help average. We would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: jarmake
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to the central train station and is easy to find. Staff seemed very helpful and friendly regarding different tourist questions I had. I stayed in a single room. Room was very clean and quiet. Only problem is the size of the shower cubicle - it's hard to wash yourself without bumping the water hotter or colder. Breakfast was typical for a three star hotel in Italy, no suprises there. Also the elevator is really small, like almost anywhere in Italy so you may have some problems getting your luggage in it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great price”
Reviews.Author: MPLSDavid
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Doria after reading all the good reviews and getting a good rate (90EUR) on one of the discount travel websites. The room was spotless clean, the bed was firm and the minibar reasonably priced. Air conditioning worked well and was not too noisy. We had a room facing the main street, which I loved for its view of the church. I am a light sleeper and had no trouble with the street noise level (the windows were very high quality). Breakfast was average quality, but the roof terrace was great! Word of caution with the bathroom - the toilet in our room was placed so it was facing the side of the sink. You literally had to slide onto the toilet, and when you were sitting on it the sink was over your knees. If you are the slightest overweight or have trouble bending over (older folks might have an issue) then this would be a real problem. Location was good, but not great. Easy walking distance to ancient Roma, some other sites were a bit of a hike but inexpensive for cabs (5 or 6 Euros). All in all well worth the rate we paid, and definitely above average for Roma.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: MaggiesWorld
Reviews.Content: Based on the other comments from this site, my husband and I booked a room at the Doria. It definitely met our expectations: a few minutes walk from Termini, centrally-located, clean, and comfortable. Just a note on the Termini neighborhood: Although it is very convenient for subway travel and travel to & from the airport, it is a somewhat crummy-looking. That said: The hotel does not look like much from outside, but as soon as we entered the lobby, we were pleasantly surprised. The hotel was tastefully decorated, and the staff was very friendly and helpful -- they were happy to provide us with information on tours and bus routes. We appreciated the fully-stocked mini bar (with decently-priced drinks), and the bathroom was sparkling clean. Our room faced the busy street overlooking the piazza, but the noise was not an issue since we had the air conditioning on. There may be more "charming" hotels in Rome, but if you can book a decent price at the Doria, you should not be disappointed.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Doria
HotelInfo.Address: Via Merulana, 4, 00185 Rome, Italy
